trans-unit.source: CSV file format for Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration preview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: CSV file format for Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration preview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B supports your cross-company relationships by enabling business partners to selectively access your corporate applications
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B supports your cross-company relationships by enabling business partners to selectively access your corporate applications

trans-unit.source: CSV file format for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration preview
trans-unit.target: CSV file format for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration preview

trans-unit.source: The preview version of Azure AD B2B collaboration requires a CSV file specifying partner user information to be uploaded through the Azure AD portal.
trans-unit.target: The preview version of Azure AD B2B collaboration requires a CSV file specifying partner user information to be uploaded through the Azure AD portal.

trans-unit.source: The CSV file should contain the required labels below, and optional fields as necessary.
trans-unit.target: The CSV file should contain the required labels below, and optional fields as necessary.

trans-unit.source: Modify the sample CSV file (below) without changing the spelling of the labels in the first row or reordering the columns.
trans-unit.target: Modify the sample CSV file (below) without changing the spelling of the labels in the first row or reordering the columns.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The first row of labels (such as Email, DisplayName...) is necessary for the CSV file to be parsed successfully.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The first row of labels (such as Email, DisplayName...) is necessary for the CSV file to be parsed successfully.

trans-unit.source: The spelling must match the fields specified below.
trans-unit.target: The spelling must match the fields specified below.

trans-unit.source: These labels identify the content beneath them.
trans-unit.target: These labels identify the content beneath them.

trans-unit.source: For optional fields that aren't needed, their labels can be removed from the CSV file.
trans-unit.target: For optional fields that aren't needed, their labels can be removed from the CSV file.

trans-unit.source: The entire column can be left empty.
trans-unit.target: The entire column can be left empty.

trans-unit.source: Required fields:
trans-unit.target: Required fields:

trans-unit.source: **Email:** Email address of invited user.
trans-unit.target: **Email:** Email address of invited user.

trans-unit.source: **DisplayName:** Display name for invited user (typically, first and last name).
trans-unit.target: **DisplayName:** Display name for invited user (typically, first and last name).

trans-unit.source: **InviteContactUsUrl:** URL to include in email invitations in case the invited user wants to contact your organization.
trans-unit.target: **InviteContactUsUrl:** URL to include in email invitations in case the invited user wants to contact your organization.

trans-unit.source: Optional fields:
trans-unit.target: Optional fields:

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppID:** The ID for the application to use for branding the email invite and acceptance pages.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppID:** The ID for the application to use for branding the email invite and acceptance pages.

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppResources:** AppIDs to corporate applications to assign users.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppResources:** AppIDs to corporate applications to assign users.

trans-unit.source: AppIDs are retrievable in PowerShell by calling `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`
trans-unit.target: AppIDs are retrievable in PowerShell by calling `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`

trans-unit.source: **InviteGroupResources:** ObjectIDs for groups to add user to.
trans-unit.target: **InviteGroupResources:** ObjectIDs for groups to add user to.

trans-unit.source: ObjectIDs are retrievable in PowerShell by calling `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId`
trans-unit.target: ObjectIDs are retrievable in PowerShell by calling `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId`

trans-unit.source: **InviteReplyURL:** URL to direct an invited user after invite acceptance.
trans-unit.target: **InviteReplyURL:** URL to direct an invited user after invite acceptance.

trans-unit.source: This should be a company-specific URL (such as [*contoso.my.salesforce.com*](http://contoso.my.salesforce.com/)).
trans-unit.target: This should be a company-specific URL (such as [*contoso.my.salesforce.com*](http://contoso.my.salesforce.com/)).

trans-unit.source: If this optional field is not specified, the invited user is directed to the App Access Panel where they can navigate to your chosen corporate apps.
trans-unit.target: If this optional field is not specified, the invited user is directed to the App Access Panel where they can navigate to your chosen corporate apps.

trans-unit.source: The App Access Panel URL is of the form `https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/applications/default.aspx?tenantId=<TenantID>`.
trans-unit.target: The App Access Panel URL is of the form `https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/applications/default.aspx?tenantId=<TenantID>`.

trans-unit.source: **Language:** Language for invitation email and redemption experience, with English as the default when unspecified.
trans-unit.target: **Language:** Language for invitation email and redemption experience, with English as the default when unspecified.

trans-unit.source: The other 10 supported language codes are:
trans-unit.target: The other 10 supported language codes are:

trans-unit.source: de: German
trans-unit.target: de: German

trans-unit.source: es: Spanish
trans-unit.target: es: Spanish

trans-unit.source: fr: French
trans-unit.target: fr: French

trans-unit.source: it: Italian
trans-unit.target: it: Italian

trans-unit.source: ja: Japanese
trans-unit.target: ja: Japanese

trans-unit.source: ko: Korean
trans-unit.target: ko: Korean

trans-unit.source: pt-BR: Portuguese (Brazil)
trans-unit.target: pt-BR: Portuguese (Brazil)

trans-unit.source: ru: Russian
trans-unit.target: ru: Russian

trans-unit.source: zh-HANS: Simplified Chinese
trans-unit.target: zh-HANS: Simplified Chinese

trans-unit.source: zh-HANT: Traditional Chinese
trans-unit.target: zh-HANT: Traditional Chinese

trans-unit.source: Sample CSV file
trans-unit.target: Sample CSV file

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample CSV you can modify.
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample CSV you can modify.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Copy and paste this into Notepad, and save it with a '.csv' file extension.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Copy and paste this into Notepad, and save it with a '.csv' file extension.

trans-unit.source: Then edit this in Excel.
trans-unit.target: Then edit this in Excel.

trans-unit.source: It will be structured into a table with labels in the first row.
trans-unit.target: It will be structured into a table with labels in the first row.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Add more optional fields in Excel by specifying the label and populating the column beneath it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Add more optional fields in Excel by specifying the label and populating the column beneath it.
